title: The west country vvooing, or, The merry conceited couple. In pleasant terms, he lets her know his mind, and fairly wooes her, for to make her kind: at first she seemed coy to his perswasion, and put him off, with many a sly evasion: but finding at the last his love was constant, her heart she did resign from that same instant. Tune of, When Sol will cast no light: or, My pritty little rogue.
publisher: Printed for W. Thackeray, T. Passenger, and W. Whitwood.,
